v8:item.v8:content: Settings in cluster to set on enable header page
Settings in cluster to set on enable header page
Settings in cluster to set on enable header information
Once security profiles are enabled in the 1C:Enterprise server cluster, the following permissions will be granted to the Infobase:
Changes in cluster required header page
Changes in cluster required header page

Security profiles that restrict accessing external resources have been set up for the infobase in the 1C:Enterprise server cluster.
To continue the actions, the content of permissions in the security profile must be changed:
Settings in cluster to set on recovery header page
Settings in cluster to set on recovery header page
Settings in cluster to set on enable header information
Restoration of the infobase security profiles in the 1C:Enterprise server cluster will grant the following permissions:
Obsolete permission cancellation required in cluster header page
Obsolete permission cancellation required in cluster header page

Security profiles that restrict accessing external resources have been set up for the infobase in the 1C:Enterprise server cluster. Permissions in security profiles in the server cluster were granted but now they are not required for running the application. The following permissions must be removed from security profiles in the server cluster:
Cannot set up permissions in the security profile:
In case of the version error of the "comcntr" component, it must be registered (session restart required).
To set up permissions in the security profile, specify parameters for connecting the server cluster where the infobase is:
Parameters for connecting to cluster through protocols pages
Infobase administrator name. Sessions are terminated on behalf of this administrator.
Infobase administrator password. Sessions are terminated on behalf of this administrator.
Once the security profile settings in the server cluster are changed, the application is restarted automatically.
Operation not supported in web client page
Operation not supported in web client page

Operation not supported in web client group
Operation not supported in web client decoration
Operation not supported in web client details group
Operation not supported in web client details group

Security profiles that restrict accessing external resources have been set up for the infobase in the 1C:Enterprise server cluster.
To continue the actions, the content of permissions in the security profile must be changed:

In the web client, one cannot change security profile settings in the server cluster.
To execute the operation, connect the application in thin client mode and execute the operation again.
Operation not supported in web client commands
Operation not supported in web client commands
Allow or deny accessing external resources
